text: Four Types of Calamity

Then Yahweh said to me, “\add Even\add* if Moses and Samuel stood ⸤before me⸥,\f + \fr 15:1 \ft Literally “to the face of me” \f* my heart \add would\add* not \add be\add* to this people. Send \add them\add* away from my ⸤sight⸥,\f + \fr 15:1 \ft Literally “face” \f* and let them go out.
⸤And then⸥\f + \fr 15:2 \ft Literally “And it will happen” \f* if they say to you, ‘Where shall we go?’ Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says Yahweh,
“\add Those\add* who \add are destined\add* for the plague, to the plague,
and \add those\add* who \add are destined\add* for the sword, to the sword,
and \add those\add* who \add are destined\add* for the famine, to the famine,
and \add those\add* who \add are destined\add* for the captivity, to the captivity.” ’

“And I will summon\f + \fr 15:3 \ft Or “appoint” \f* over them four types of calamity,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 15:3 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “the sword to kill, and the dogs to drag away, and the birds\f + \fr 15:3 \ft Hebrew “bird” \f* of the air and the wild animals\f + \fr 15:3 \ft Hebrew “wild animal” \f* of the earth to devour and to destroy.
And I will make them a terror to all of the kingdoms of the earth because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, the king of Judah, because of what he did in Jerusalem.
“For who will have compassion on you, \add O\add* Jerusalem,
or who will show sympathy to you,
or who will turn aside ⸤to ask about your welfare⸥?\f + \fr 15:5 \ft Literally “to ask to the welfare of you” \f*
You have forsaken me,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 15:6 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“You go backward, so I have stretched my hand against you,
and I have destroyed you.
I am tired of becoming remorseful.
And I have winnowed them with a winnowing fork in the gates of the land.
I am bereaved.
I have destroyed my people.
They did not turn back from their ways.
Their widows\f + \fr 15:8 \ft Hebrew “widow” \f* will be more numerous before me than \add the\add* sand of \add the\add* seas.
I have brought to them, against \add the\add* mothers\f + \fr 15:8 \ft Hebrew “mother” \f* of young men,\f + \fr 15:8 \ft Hebrew “man” \f*
a destroyer at noon.
I will suddenly drop on her anguish and horror.\f + \fr 15:8 \ft Hebrew “horrors” \f*
She who gave birth to seven has withered away.
She gasps her breath.
Her sun ⸤set⸥\f + \fr 15:9 \ft Literally “came” \f* while still day.
She has been put to shame and disgraced.
And the remainder of them I will give to the sword
⸤before⸥\f + \fr 15:9 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* their enemies,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 15:9 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
Jeremiah’s Lament and Yahweh’s Response
Woe to me, \add O\add* my mother, that you gave birth to me,
a man of contention and quarreling ⸤to the whole land⸥.\f + \fr 15:10 \ft Literally “to all of the land” \f*
I have not lent out and ⸤I have not borrowed⸥.\f + \fr 15:10 \ft Literally “not they have lent out for me” \f*
All of them \add are\add* cursing me.
Yahweh said,
“⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 15:11 \ft Literally “If not” \f* I will set you free ⸤to be good⸥\f + \fr 15:11 \ft Literally “for good” \f* for you,
⸤surely⸥\f + \fr 15:11 \ft Literally “if not” \f* I will cause the enemy to intercede with you
in a time of trouble,
and in a time of distress.
Can anyone break iron,
iron from the north, or bronze?
I will give your wealth and your treasures
as plunder without price,
even because of all your sins,
and throughout all your territories.
And I will make you serve your enemies
in a land \add that\add* you \add do\add* not know,
for a fire will kindle in my anger.
Upon you it will be kindled.”
You who know, \add O\add* Yahweh, remember me, and attend to me,
and take revenge for me against my persecutors ⸤in your forbearance⸥.\f + \fr 15:15 \ft Literally “in the length of your nose” \f*
You must take me away.
Know \add that\add* I \add am\add* carrying disgrace because of you.
Your words were found and I ate them,
and your words became to me as jubilation,
even as the joy of my heart,
for your name is called on me, \add O\add* Yahweh God of hosts.
I sat not in the assembly of jokers,
\add nor did\add* I exult.
Because of the ⸤presence⸥\f + \fr 15:17 \ft Literally “face” \f* of your hand I sat alone,
for you filled me \add with\add* indignation.
Why is my pain endless, and my wound incurable?
It refuses to become healed.
Truly you are to me like a deceitful \add brook\add*,
waters \add that\add* are not trustworthy.
Therefore thus says Yahweh,
“If you turn back, then I will take you back.
You will stand ⸤before me⸥.\f + \fr 15:19 \ft Literally “to the face of me” \f*
And if you utter \add what is\add* precious and not \add what is\add* worthless,
you will be as my mouth.
They will turn back to you,
and you will not turn back to them.
And I will make you to this people
a wall of fortified bronze,
and they will fight against you,
but they will not prevail over you,
for I \add am\add* with you, to save you,
and to deliver you,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 15:20 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“And I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked,
and I will redeem you from \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* tyrant.”
